node.Title: CDK for Terraform 0.14 Makes it Easier to Use Providers
node.Description: Cloud Development Kit for Terraform (CDKTF) 0.14 makes it easier to add and upgrade Terraform providers.

node.Title: How Atlassian used Snyk to solve Log4Shell
node.Description: In this post, we’ll recap Walz’s experience using Snyk to detect and remediate Log4Shell at Atlassian, as well as Silverman’s more in-depth talk about the impact of Log4Shell.

node.Title: You can add biometric authentication to your webpage. Here’s how.
node.Description:
Prompting for a username and password is so 2005. Today, you can just prompt for a fingerprint.

The post You can add biometric authentication to your webpage. Here’s how. appeared first on Stack Overflow Blog.

node.Title: UPDATE Supercloud SET status = 'open alpha' WHERE product = 'D1';
node.Description: As we continue down the road to making D1 production ready, it wouldn’t be “the Cloudflare way” unless we stopped for feedback first. D1 is now in Open Alpha!

node.Title: Bringing authentication and identification to Workers through Mutual TLS
node.Description: We’re excited to announce that Workers will soon be able to send outbound requests through a mutually authenticated channel via mutual TLS authentication!

node.Title: The Cloudflare API now uses OpenAPI schemas
node.Description: Cloudflare now has OpenAPI Schemas available for the API. Users can use these schemas in any open source OpenAPI Tooling.

node.Title: Iteration isn't just for code: here are our latest API docs
node.Description: We’re excited to share that the next iteration of Cloudflare’s API reference documentation is now available. The new docs standardize our API content and improve the overall developer experience for interacting with Cloudflare’s API.

node.Title: Making static sites dynamic with Cloudflare D1
node.Description: In this blog post, I'll show you how to use D1 to add comments to a static blog site. To do this, we'll construct a new D1 database and build a simple JSON API that allows the creation and retrieval of comments.

node.Title: Automate an isolated browser instance with just a few lines of code
node.Description: Workers Browser Rendering API is our out-of-the-box solution for simplifying developer workflows, including capturing images or screenshots, by running browser automation in Workers. If you’re interested, sign up for the waitlist.

node.Title: Xata Workers: client-side database access without client-side secrets
node.Description: Xata is on a mission to solve the industry’s hardest data problems with their Serverless Data Platform. We’re excited to have Xata building their serverless functions product – Xata Workers – on top of Workers for Platforms. Here is Xata’s story.

node.Title: Evernote’s Next Move: Joining the Bending Spoons Suite of Apps
node.Description:

node.Title: Now Open–AWS Region in Spain
node.Description: The AWS Region in Aragón, Spain, is now open. The official name is Europe (Spain), and the API name is eu-south-2. You can start using it today to deploy workloads and store your data in Spain. The AWS Europe (Spain) Region has three Availability Zones (AZ) that you can use to reliably spread your applications […]

node.Description: The AWS Heroes program celebrates and recognizes builders who are making an impact within the global AWS community. node.Title: Sapling: Source control that’s user-friendly and scalable
node.Description:
Sapling is a new Git-compatible source control client. Sapling emphasizes usability while also scaling to the largest repositories in the world. ReviewStack is a demonstration code review UI for GitHub pull requests that integrates with Sapling to make reviewing stacks of commits easy. You can get started using Sapling today.  Source control is one of [...]

Read More...

The post Sapling: Source control that’s user-friendly and scalable appeared first on Engineering at Meta.

node.Title: How community participation can enhance your development career
node.Description: In this article, we’ll talk about some opportunities for community participationa few ways you can give back to your community while also developing your career.

node.Title: 5 best practices for building modern access control for cloud applications
node.Description: Learn best practices for building modern access control for cloud applications, covering RBAC, security and compliace, IAM, access control layers, reducing attack surface area, and more.

node.Description:

node.Title: Migrate from S3 easily with the R2 Super Slurper
node.Description: Today we're announcing the R2 Super Slurper, the tool that will enable you to migrate all your data to R2 in a simple and efficient way

node.Title: Reduce origin load, save on cloud egress fees, and maximize cache hits with Cache Reserve
node.Description: Today we’re extremely excited to announce that Cache Reserve is graduating to open beta – users will now be able to test it and integrate it into their content delivery strategy without any additional waiting

node.Title: Indexing millions of HTTP requests using Durable Objects
node.Description: A deep-dive into how Cloudflare uses Durable Objects and the Streams API to index millions of HTTP requests stored in R2

node.Title: Store and process your Cloudflare Logs... with Cloudflare
node.Description: Today we’re announcing Cloudflare Logs Engine — a new system that will enable you to do anything you need with Cloudflare Logs, all within Cloudflare
